title: Does the Constitution Guarantee  a Right to Vote?
description: For decades, the courts and Congress have taken the lead in expanding the legal right to vote, but the founders never explicitly included it.
dc:creator: Michael Wines
media:credit: Jonah Markowitz for The New York Times
media:description: Various constitutional amendments prohibit denying voting rights to women, racial minorities and other groups. But the Constitution contains no explicit right to vote.
